1.3.12 Release Notes

Release date: February 08 2006

This is a bugfix release. It addresses a problem that prevented Clover-instrumented classes from loading correctly in JBoss 3.x under some conditions. It also includes various minor improvements and bugfixes.

Documentation

For information about installing, configuring and using Clover, please consult the Clover User Manual.

For the most current documentation, please visit http://www.cenqua.com/clover.

License

You will need a valid Clover license file to run Clover. You can obtain a free 30 day evaluation license or purchase a commercial license at http://www.cenqua.com

To install your Clover license file, you need to do one of the following:

  • Place the license file next to the Clover jar file (or next to the Clover plugin jar file, if you are running a Clover IDE plugin).
  • Place the license file on the Java Classpath that will be used to run Clover.
  • Place the license file on the file system somewhere, and then set the Java System Property clover.license.path to the absolute path of the license file.

Feedback

Our Online Forums are a great place to get help with Clover or suggest a new feature. Its easier for us to help you if you include the following information in your post:
  • Java Runtime version
  • Clover version
  • Ant version
  • Operating system
  • IDE version
  • Hosting app server if any

Alternatively, you can get support by mailing the Clover Team directly at clover-support@cenqua.com

Sales

For Clover sales or licensing questions, please email us at clover-sales@cenqua.com

Changes in 1.3.7

Important Note:

Clover 1.3.7 introduces changes to the format and naming of coverage recording files. Recordings made with previous versions of Clover are not compatible with Clover 1.3.7. This won't affect you unless you are using spans when generating reports or historypoints, and you keep old coverage recording files. You should ensure that all old coverage recording files have been deleted before using Clover 1.3.7.

Clover recording files can now have names of the form:

clover.dbHHHHHHH_TTTTTTTTTT or
clover.dbHHHHHHH_TTTTTTTTTT.1 (new)

Users that copy recording files from remote testing environments will need to ensure that they copy both forms of recording.
